messages.title: Why should I vote?
messages.content: Labour are dedicated to standing up for Wales, at all layers of government. We put the needs of constituents first.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: More police on the beat and reverse police budget cuts.
Keep the triple lock on pensions and support WASPI women.
Stop the third child rape clause on tax credits.
Raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The Prime Minister has called a General Election to distract attention from the Tory failings.
mentions.partyLeader: Carwyn Jones AM, Leader of Welsh Labour

issues.government: Voting system: reverse police budget cuts. Governance: Representation for WASPI women.
issues.health: Carolyn's call for a children's funeral fund to make sure it happens in Wales.
issues.labourEmployment: Raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour.
issues.lawCrime: More police on the beat and reverse police budget cuts.
issues.socialWelfare: Stop the third child rape clause on tax credits. Triple lock for pensioners. Increase minimum wage.

community.content: We have distributed hundreds of food parcels for people in need.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been standing up for Swansea East, ensuring you are represented by someone who understands the community and shares your values and priorities.

politicalExperience.role: Vice-President of Chartered Trading Standards Institute

contactInformation.address: 18 Osterley Street, St Thomas, Swansea SA1 8HJ

endorsements.endorser: Carwyn Jones AM, Leader of Welsh Labour
endorsements.endorsement: The Welsh Labour Government was delighted to be able to respond to Carolyn's call for a children's funeral fund and to make sure it happens in Wales.

endorsements.endorser: Mike Hedges, Labour Assembly Member Swansea East
endorsements.endorsement: I have worked closely with Carolyn over the past few years. She is enthusiastic, hardworking, and extremely caring about the community where we live.
